title: VectorCrossProduct doesn't make perpendicular vector
question:
When I use the rs.VectorCrossProduct command for to coplanar vectors, the resulting vector is not normal to the plane and does not appear to be orthogonal to the two original vectors.  
testMRIcombine-editor.py
 (11.9 KB)

code_blocks.code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs

pts = rs.GetPoints(max_points=3)
vec1 = rs.VectorCreate(pts[0], pts[1])
vec2 = rs.VectorCreate(pts[0], pts[2])
rs.AddLine(pts[0], pts[1])
rs.AddLine(pts[0], pts[2])
vec3 = rs.VectorCrossProduct(vec1, vec2)
rs.AddLine(pts[0], rs.PointAdd(pts[0], vec3))
